decks.notes: This deck focuses on maintaining control over the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. With Atraxa, Grand Unifier as the commander, the deck aims to outvalue opponents by leveraging powerful cards like Cryptic Command, Demonic Tutor, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. By consistently disrupting opponents' strategies and ensuring card advantage, the deck can grind out wins through attrition. It also includes a mix of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Swords to Plowshares to deal with threats on the board. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes a variety of dual lands to ensure smooth mana development throughout the game.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively with Gut, True Soul Zealot as the commander, supported by a mix of efficient creatures, removal spells, and disruptive spells to control the board and apply pressure on the opponent. The deck uses cards like Lightning Bolt, Swords to Plowshares, and Flame Slash to remove threats while deploying creatures like Goblin Guide, Kari Zev, Skyship Raider, and Breeches, Eager Pillager to attack and deal damage quickly. The deck also includes disruptive creatures like Drannith Magistrate and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to hinder the opponent's game plan. With a mix of efficient creatures, removal, and disruption, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck revolves around playing aggressive red creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent and win the game. The strategy is to establish early board presence with efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to remove threats or finish off the opponent. Cards like Sulfuric Vortex and Eidolon of the Great Revel punish opponents for casting spells, while cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance provide additional sources of damage and card advantage. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent, utilizing cheap spells and creatures to chip away at their life total and secure a victory.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, putting constant pressure on their life total and board state. The deck includes efficient creatures like Goblin Guide, Monastery Swiftspear, and Phoenix of Ash, along with a wide range of burn spells such as Lightning Bolt, Rift Bolt, and Searing Blaze. The commander, Feldon, Ronom Excavator, provides value by recurring key creatures from the graveyard. The deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they can stabilize, using a combination of creature beats and direct damage spells. The mana base is optimized for speed and consistency, enabling the deck to consistently apply pressure and close out games swiftly.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells and bouncing opponent's threats, while also utilizing card draw and manipulation to maintain card advantage. The commander, Malcolm, Alluring Scoundrel, supports this strategy by generating treasures to ramp into powerful spells quickly. The deck includes a wide range of disruptive spells like counterspells, bounce spells, and disruptive creatures to keep the opponent on the back foot. Additionally, there are efficient card advantage engines like Curious Obsession and Mystic Confluence to ensure the deck can keep up with the opponent. By utilizing a mix of disruption and card advantage, this deck aims to out-value and outmaneuver the opponent in a 1 vs 1 format.
